questions.question: What is the difference between a hot wallet and a cold wallet?

answers.a: A hot wallet is connected to the internet, while a cold wallet is not.
answers.b: A hot wallet is a software program, while a cold wallet is a hardware device.
answers.c: A hot wallet is more secure than a cold wallet.
answers.d: A cold wallet is more expensive than a hot wallet.

questions.question: What is a gas fee and why do you have to pay one?

answers.a: A gas fee is a transaction fee that users must pay to process transactions on the Ethereum blockchain.
answers.b: A gas fee is a reward that miners receive for processing transactions.
answers.c: A gas fee is a tax that the government charges on cryptocurrency transactions.
answers.d: A gas fee is a fee that users must pay to access the MetaMask wallet.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a benefit of using MetaMask?

answers.a: It is a secure and easy-to-use wallet for storing and managing Ethereum and other ERC-20 tokens.
answers.b: It allows you to connect to decentralized applications (DApps) and interact with them directly from your browser.
answers.c: It is a non-custodial wallet, which means that you have full control over your private keys and funds.
answers.d: It requires you to share your private keys with MetaMask servers for safekeeping.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a seed phrase in a crypto wallet?

answers.a: It is used to encrypt wallet transactions for security.
answers.b: It serves as a backup to recover your wallet if you lose access.
answers.c: It is required to send crypto transactions.
answers.d: It is a passcode for accessing DApps.

questions.question: How can you ensure the security of your MetaMask wallet?

answers.a: Never share your seed phrase with anyone.
answers.c: Use a strong password and keep your device secure.
